de.esoco.lib.expression

Class StringFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.expression.StringFunctions

  • public class StringFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains factory methods for string-specific functions and predicates.

      • isEmpty

        public static Predicate<java.lang.CharSequence> isEmpty()
        Returns a predicate constant that checks whether a character sequence is empty. The checked value is considered empty if it is NULL or has a length of zero.
        Returns:
        A predicate constant that tests for empty strings

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(java.lang.CharSequence sString)
        Checks whether a string variable is empty (NULL or has a length of zero).
        Parameters:
        sString - The string to test
        Returns:
        TRUE if the string variable is empty

      • isValidIdnUnicode

        public static Predicate<java.lang.String> isValidIdnUnicode()
        Returns a predicate constant that checks whether a string contains a valid internationalized domain name in Unicode format. This is achieved by invoking IDN.toASCII(String) on the input string and checking for exceptions.
        Returns:
        A predicate constant that tests for empty strings

      • notEmpty

        public static Predicate<java.lang.CharSequence> notEmpty()
        Returns a predicate constant that checks whether a character sequence is not empty. The checked value is considered not empty if it is not NULL and has a length greater than zero.
        Returns:
        A predicate constant that tests for not empty strings

      • split

        Parameters:
        sPattern - The regular expression pattern

      • substring

        public static GetSubstring substring(int nBeginIndex,
                                     int nEndIndex)
        Returns a new instance of GetSubstring that has a substring of an input string as it's result. See String.substring(int, int) for details.
        Parameters:
        nBeginIndex - The index of the first char of the substring
        nEndIndex - The index of the char after the last char of the substring or -1 for the end of the input string
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • toByteArray

        public static InvertibleFunction<java.lang.String,byte[]> toByteArray()
        Returns an invertible function constant that converts a string to a byte array and vice versa. Applies the method String.getBytes() or the constructor String.String(byte[]) for the inversion. NULL values are ignored and will also yield NULL.
        Returns:
        A function constant

      • toCollection

        public static <C extends java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> BinaryFunction<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,C> toCollection(java.lang.Class<C> rCollectionClass,
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String sSplitPattern,
                                                                                                                                  boolean bTrim)
        Returns a new binary function instance that converts a string into a modifiable collection of strings by splitting it around a certain regular expression pattern. See the documentation of String.split(String) for details.
        Parameters:
        rCollectionClass - The type of collection to create
        sSplitPattern - The regular expression split pattern
        bTrim - TRUE if each list element should be trimmed with String.trim()
        Returns:
        A new binary function instance

        bTrim - TRUE if each list element should be trimmed

      • toSet

        public static <C extends java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> BinaryFunction<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> toSet(java.lang.String sSplitPattern,
                                                                                                                                                         boolean bTrim,
                                                                                                                                                         boolean bOrdered)
        Returns a new binary function instance that converts a string into a modifiable list of strings by splitting it around a certain regular expression pattern. See the documentation of String.split(String) for details.
        Parameters:
        sSplitPattern - The regular expression split pattern
        bTrim - TRUE if each list element should be trimmed
        bOrdered - TRUE if the resulting set shall keep the original order of the elements in an input string
        Returns:
        A new binary function instance
